item.description:
Straight from the polls comes our second selection for June (sorry for the delay in posting, but it's a short one so I'm hoping we can fit it in)

Coraline by Neil Gaiman

Copied from: http://www.powells.co...

Publisher Comments:
When Coraline steps through a door to find another house strangely similar to her own (only better), things seem marvelous.

But there's another mother there, and another father, and they want her to stay and be their little girl. They want to change her and never let her go.

Coraline will have to fight with all her wit and courage if she is to save herself and return to her ordinary life.


Since it's all wet and rainy, let's just shoot for Au Bon Pain in Harvard Square. There's still a slim chance I may miss this one, but will keep you posted and want to get us reading regardless:-)

Happy reading:-)
item.name: Cambridge Readers: Coraline by Neil Gaiman
